info.title: Cargoson API v1
info.description:
Cargoson API can be used to exchange shipment information with Cargoson via REST API.

Cargoson API uses API keys to authenticate requests. You can request an API key by writing to us at support@cargoson.com.
    
All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new query in Cargoson. 

If a ```direct_booking_service_id``` is provided, a booking will be created as well.  ```parcel_machine_reference``` can be also be provided alongside the service id, if it is a parcel machine service. 

If ```automated_booking``` option is provided, the service will be automatically chosen based on user-defined rules and a booking will be created.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

201.description:
Query created, and the created query is found in the response body. 

You can find the label and tracking URLs in the elements ```label_url``` and ```tracking_url```, respectively. When visiting these URLs the user will not see any content until the shipment is booked in Cargoson.

422.description:
Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

If you included the option to immediately book the shipment to a specific carrier's service (options/direct_booking_service_id), it is possible that the shipment was created but it couldn't be booked to the requested service. When this happens, you will see the created query elements, along with a ```"query_status": "created"``` and a ```"booking_status": "failed"```. The error messages will be included in the ```errors``` array.

403.description: The API key does not have enough privileges to complete this operation.

declaration_attributes.declaration_text: I/We hereby certify that the information on this declaration is true and correct and that the contents of this shipment are as stated above.

patch.description:
This endpoint is used to edit an existing query which has no bookings or quotes in Cargoson. 

Including new ```rows_attributes``` will overwrite any and all previous rows.

If a ```direct_booking_service_id``` option is provided, a booking will be created.  ```parcel_machine_reference``` can be also be provided alongside the service id, if it is a parcel machine service. 

If ```automated_booking``` option is provided, the service will be automatically chosen based on user-defined rules and a booking will be created.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or reference of the query

200.description:
Query is changed, and the query is found in the response body. 

You can find the label and tracking URLs in the elements ```label_url``` and ```tracking_url```, respectively. When visiting these URLs the user will not see any content until the shipment is booked in Cargoson.

422.description:
Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

If you included the option to immediately book the shipment to a specific carrier's service (options/direct_booking_service_id), it is possible that the shipment was created but it couldn't be booked to the requested service. When this happens, you will see the created query elements, along with a ```"query_status": "created"``` and a ```"booking_status": "failed"```. The error messages will be included in the ```errors``` array.

404.description: A query with the provided ID could not be found

403.description: The API key does not have enough privileges to complete this operation or a booking/quote exists for the shipment

delete.description:
This endpoint is used to delete an existing query which has no bookings in Cargoson. 

If a ```direct_booking_service_id``` is provided, a booking will be created as well.  ```parcel_machine_reference``` can be also be provided alongside the service id, if it is a parcel machine service.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or reference of the query

422.description:
Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

If you included the option to immediately book the shipment to a specific carrier's service (options/direct_booking_service_id), it is possible that the shipment was created but it couldn't be booked to the requested service. When this happens, you will see the created query elements, along with a ```"query_status": "created"``` and a ```"booking_status": "failed"```. The error messages will be included in the ```errors``` array.

403.description: The API key does not have enough privileges to complete this operation or shipment is already booked

404.description: A query with the provided ID could not be found

get.description:
This endpoint is used to get information about a shipment which is already booked to a carrier (a booking). 

Either an ID or a reference (XX12345) must be provided.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or reference of the booking to return

200.description: The request was successful and the booking attributes are included in the response body

401.description: Unauthorized request or the requested booking was not found (invalid ID/reference)

patch.description:
This endpoint is used to edit an existing booking in Cargoson. 

Including new ```rows_attributes``` will overwrite any and all previous rows.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or reference of the booking

200.description:
Booking is changed, and the Booking is found in the response body. 

You can find the label and tracking URLs in the elements ```label_url``` and ```tracking_url```, respectively. When visiting these URLs the user will not see any content until the shipment is booked in Cargoson.

422.description: Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

404.description: A booking with the provided ID could not be found

403.description: The API key does not have enough privileges to complete this operation

delete.description:
This endpoint is used to delete an existing booking in Cargoson. 

This cannot be undone and should be agreed upon with the carrier beforehand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or reference of the booking

422.description: Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

403.description: The API key does not have enough privileges to complete this operation

post.summary: Return a list of prices for a shipment
post.description: This endpoint is used to get a list of prices for a shipment from different carriers from Cargoson. The returned prices are sourced from the user's personal price lists or from the online prices of the user's carriers.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The API can read JSON messages. The value should be application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

200.description: The request was successful and the found prices are included in the response body

204.description: The request was valid but no results were found

422.description: Unprocessable entry - the request was invalid

get.summary: Return a list of parcel machines
get.description: Return a list of parcel machines. All of the returned parcel machines only belong to the carriers that are activated in the account (no irrelevant machines are returned). Additional search filters can be applied to limit the size of the response.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Return parcel machines only from this two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

parameters.name: carrier_id
parameters.description: Return parcel machines only from this carrier ID

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Return parcel machines only from this postcode

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Return parcel machines that have this reference. If the reference is correct, it will normally return exactly one parcel machine. But, since the references are defined by the carriers, it is not guaranteed that parcel machines have unique references and therefore it might return more parcel machines. It is recommended to add additional filters, such as ```carrier_id``` to avoid this problem.

200.description: The request was successful and the parcel machines are included in the response body. If the response body is an empty array, no parcel machines were found based on your criteria.

post.summary: Return expected CO2e emissions for a shipment
post.description: Returns a list of expected CO2e emissions in kg for applicaple freight types

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: This header is for defining the API version. The value should be application/vnd.api.v1

200.description: The request was successful and the calculated coordinates, distances and co2e emissions are in the return body

422.description: Couldn't (fully) complete request due to some issue in the input data. You can find the error messages in the ```errors``` array.

collection_date.description: Date when goods are ready for collection. Can be today or in the future

collection_time_from.description: Must be before collection time to. Cannot be less than current local time if collection date is set to today

collection_time_to.description: Must be after collection time from

delivery_date.description: Desired delivery date. Must be equal to the collection date or later

delivery_time_from.description: Must be before delivery time to. If collection and delivery dates match then must be after collection time to

delivery_time_to.description: Must be after delivery time from

collection_company_name.description: The name of the company the goods are collected from

collection_postcode.description: ZIP or postal code. May contain both numbers and letters. Should not include the country code.

collection_city.description: City, district, suburb, town or village

collection_contact_name.description: The name of the person that the driver can contact

collection_contact_phone.description: The phone number of the person that the driver can contact

collection_contact_email.description: The email of the person that the carrier can contact

collection_comment.description: Additional collection related information. (e.g., "Code to enter the gate is 1234")

delivery_company_name.description: The name of the company the goods are delivered to

delivery_postcode.description: ZIP or postal code. May contain both numbers and letters. Should not include the country code.

delivery_city.description: City, district, suburb, town or village

delivery_contact_name.description: The name of the person that the driver can contact

delivery_contact_phone.description: The phone number of the person that the driver can contact

delivery_contact_email.description: The email of the person that the carrier can contact

delivery_comment.description: Additional delivery related information. (e.g., "Code to enter the gate is 1234")

goods_value.description: The monetary value of the goods

frigo.description: Indicates whether the goods are temperature sensitive

incoterm_code.description: International Commercial Terms are a series of pre-defined commercial terms published by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) relating to international commercial law

customer_remark.description: Important additional information for the carrier

collection_with_tail_lift.description: Indicates whether the collection should be performed with a tail-lift truck

collection_prenotification.description: Indicates whether the driver should call the collection contact before loading

delivery_with_tail_lift.description: Indicates whether the delivery should be performed with a tail-lift truck

delivery_prenotification.description: Indicates whether the driver should call the delivery contact before loading

delivery_return_document.description: Indicates whether the customer expects signed documents to be returned

delivery_to_private_person.description: Indicates whether the goods will be delivered to a private person instead of a company

documents_attributes.description: Array of files that will be attached to the shipment

category.description: Type of the document selected from the predefined document types

annex.description: File content in Base64 encoded string

rows_attributes.description: Array of goods rows, with each row consisting of the following 7 (or less) key-value pairs and an array of ADR rows (not required)

package_type.description: Type of the package selected from the predefined package types

weight.description: Total weight in kilograms of the goods described in the row. If there are 5 EUR pallets, 100kg each, then the weight is 500 kg

ldm.description: Row area in loading meters (ex.: 1 EUR pallet = 0.4 LDM)

description.description: Description of the goods in this row

adr_rows_attributes.description: Array of dangerous goods rows that are included in this goods row, with each row consisting of the following 5 (or less) key-value pairs

adr_un.description: Four-digit UN number that identifies hazardous materials, and articles

adr_group.description: I - high danger, II - medium danger, III - low danger

adr_class.description: 1 - Explosives, 2 - Gases, 3 - Flammable liquids, 4 - Flammable solids

adr_neq.description: The weight or volume of the dangerous goods contained in a package excluding the weight or volume of any packaging material; or the weight of an unpackaged article of dangerous goods

total_price.description: Price for the shipment that has been previously agreed upon with carrier

currency.description: Currency of agreed price. Defaults to user's company's currency if not provided

label_format.description:
The response includes a link to the goods labels. The link will be empty until the shipment is booked in Cargoson. You can choose the format of those labels with this option. 

**a4** => up to four A6 labels per one A4 page. 

**label_printer** => one label per page in the size of 4x6 inches (10.16 x 15.24 cm, which is close to the A6 format.)

direct_booking_service_id.description: If you wish to submit the booking immediately, you can enter the ID of the desired carrier's service. You can request the service IDs from Cargoson support.

create_incomplete_shipment.description: Indicates if you want the shipment to be saved for later editing even if booking itself fails

automated_booking.description: Indicates if you want the shipment to be automatically booked based on rules defined in Cargoson by the user

save_collection_address.description: Indicates if you want to save the collection address in Cargoson's address book for later use

save_delivery_address.description: Indicates if you want to save the delivery address in Cargoson's address book for later use

parcel_machine_reference.description: If ```direct_booking_service_id``` was defined, and the service id is for a parcel machine service, you can define the desired parcel machine here. If the service is a parcel machine service but this element is not defined, the closest parcel machine to the delivery address will be selected. You can request the desired parcel machine references from Cargoson support. Do not use if the ```direct_booking_service_id``` was not used or is not a parcel machine service ID:

declaration_attributes.description: If the shipment requires a customs declaration, these fields should be filled

invoice_reference.description:
Invoice reference.  

ACL - Parent Shipment ID for BBX  
CID - Customer Identifier  
CN - Contract Number  
CU - Consignor reference number  
ITN - US Export declaration reference ID  
MRN - Movement Reference number  
UCN - Unique reference of a consignment (UCRN)  
OID - Order Number  
PON - Purchase Order Number  
RMA - RMA Number  
AAM - AWB Ref #  
ABT - Goods Declaration number  
ADA - Buyer Reference number  
AES - AES Post Clearance  
AFD - 1496 Item number  
ANT - Consignee Reference number  
BKN - Booking Number  
BOL - Bill of Lading Number  
CDN - Customs Declaration number  
COD - Cash On Delivery  
DSC - Weltpaket Reference  
FF - Freight forwarder's reference number  
FN - Freight bill number  
FTR - Post Clearance Exemption US  
HWB - Shipment Identifiers  
IBC - Inbound center reference number  
IPP - Insurance Policy Provider  
LLR - Load list reference  
MAB - Master Airwaybill Number  
MWB - MAWB Reference number  
OBC - Outbound center reference number  
PD - Vendor Reference Number  
PRN - Pickup request number  
RTL - Return Leg waybill number  
SID - Shipment ID 15 Digit CODA  
SS - Seller Reference number  
SWN - Original Waybill number (Return)

currency.description: Currency for all values in declaration. ISO 4217

declaration_text.description: Field to explicity state that the information declared is correct

unit_of_measure.description:
Unit of measure of stated quanity. (Usually Pieces)   
BOX: Boxes  
2GM: Centigram  
2M: Centimeters  
2M3: Cubic Centimeters  
3M3: Cubic Feet  
M3: Cubic Meters  
DPR: Dozen Pairs  
DOZ: Dozen  
2NO: Each  
PCS: Pieces  
GM: Grams  
GRS: Gross  
KG: Kilograms  
L: Liters  
M: Meters  
3GM: Milligrams  
3L: Milliliters  
X: No Unit Required  
NO: Number  
2KG: Ounces  
PRS: Pairs  
2L: Gallons  
3KG: Pounds  
CM2: Square Centimeters  
2M2: Square Feet  
3M2: Square Inches  
M2: Square Meters  
4M2: Square Yards  
3M: Yards

hs_code.description: TARIC (10 digits), Combined Nomenclature (8 digits) or Harmonised System code (6 digits) for goods

net_weight.description: Net weight of goods (kg) PER ITEM

gross_weight.description: Gross weight of goods (kg) PER ITEM

description.description: Description of the goods, as descriptive as possible

category.description:
Charge type  
  
ADMIN: Administration fee  
DELIV: Delivery fee  
DOCUM: Documentation fee  
EXPED: Expedite fee  
EXCHA: Export fee  
FRCST: Freight cost  
SSRGE: Fuel surcharge  
LOGST: Logistic fee  
SOTHR: Other fee  
SPKGN: Packaging/packing fee  
PICUP: Pickup fee  
HRCRG: Handling fee  
VATCR: VAT fee  
INSCH: Insurance cost  
REVCH: Reverse charge

declaration_documents_attributes.description: Document references related to declaration. These files should be included in the ```documents_attributes```

category.description:
Document type  
  
972: T2LF Dispense Paiement Droits  
AHC: Analysis and Health Certificate  
ATA: ATA Carnet  
ATR: Preference Certificate ATR  
CHD: CHED-D (Common Health Entry Document for Feed and Food of Non-Animal Origin)  
CHP: CHED-P (Common Health Entry Document for Products)  
CIT: CITES Certificate  
COO: Generic Certificate of Origin  
DEX: Duty Exemption Certificate  
EU1: Preference Certificate EUR1  
EU2: Preferential Declaration of Origin on the Invoice - EUR2  
EUS: End Use Authorization  
FMA: Certificate of Origin (Form A)  
PHY: Phytosanitary Certificate  
VET: Veterinary Entry Document  
VEX: VAT Exemption Certificate  
CRL: Control Document  
CSD: Consolidated Customs Entry  
PPY: Proof Of Payment  
CI2: Export-only Invoice  
CIV: Customs Invoice Value  
DOV: Invoice  
INV: Commercial Invoice  
PFI: Pro-Forma  
ALC: Agricultural License  
HLC: Health Products RegulatoryAuthority (HPRA) Licensing Requirements  
JLC: Justice License  
LIC: Specific Export Licenses  
LNP: License or Permit  
PLI: Permits & Licenses  
DLI: Driver's License  
NID: National Identity Card  
PAS: Passport  
CHA: Power of Attorney  
CPA: Consignee Power of Attorney  
POA: Power of Attorney (Customer-based)  
BEX: Branch Letter of Exemption  
DGD: Dangerous Goods Declaration  
IPA: Intellectual Property Authorization  
T2M: T2M Transport Accompanying Document  
TAD: TAD Transport Accompanying Document T1  
TCS: Transportation Charges Statement  
ROD: Receipt on Delivery  
EXL: DCE Export of Customs Data  
HWB: House Waybill  
ELP: Export Licenses and Permits

PriceRequestShipment.description: the shipment for which the prices are requested

collection_date.description: Date when goods are ready for collection. Can be today or in the future

collection_postcode.description: ZIP or postal code. May contain both numbers and letters. Should not include the country code.

delivery_postcode.description: ZIP or postal code. May contain both numbers and letters. Should not include the country code.

frigo.description: Indicates whether the goods are temperature sensitive

adr.description: Indicates whether the shipment is hazardous (ADR). The shipment is hazardous if any of its goods contain hazardous goods

collection_prenotification.description: Indicates whether the driver should call the collection contact before loading

collection_with_tail_lift.description: Indicates whether the collection should be performed with a tail-lift truck

delivery_prenotification.description: Indicates whether the driver should call the delivery contact before loading

delivery_with_tail_lift.description: Indicates whether the delivery should be performed with a tail-lift truck

delivery_return_document.description: Indicates whether the customer expects signed documents to be returned

delivery_to_private_person.description: Indicates whether the goods will be delivered to a private person instead of a company

rows_attributes.description: Array of goods rows, with each row consisting of the following 7 (or less) key-value pairs

package_type.description: Type of the package selected from the predefined package types

weight.description: Total weight in kilograms of the goods described in the row. If there are 5 EUR pallets, 100kg each, then the weight is 500 kg

ldm.description: Row area in loading metres (ex.: 1 EUR pallet = 0.4 LDM)

description.description: Description of the goods in this row

GetBookingRequestBody.description: Request body for defining different options for fetching a booking

options.description: Object that holds different options for fetching data about the booking

label_format.description:
The response includes a link to the goods labels. You can choose the format of those labels with this option. 

```a4``` => up to four A6 labels per one A4 page. 

```label_printer``` => one label per page in the size of 4x6 inches (10.16 x 15.24 cm, which is close to the A6 format.)

include_associations.description: Object that holds options for which attribute groups to fetch. By default, these additional attributes are all disabled. Enable only what you need, since every additional step will make the request a bit slower.

offer.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the selected offer (price, service, carrier etc).

carrier.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the selected carrier.

consignor.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the consignor (sender).

consignee.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the consignee (receiver).

rows.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the goods rows.

declaration.description: Indicates whether you want to receive information about the declaration.

object.description: The object containing the prices array

items.description: A price object detailing the price of the shipment, the carrier and the service whom which the price is from, and the source of the price

carrier.description: The name of the carrier from which the price is from

id.description: The numeric ID of the carrier for more reliable identification

reg_no.description: The business registration number of the carrier

service.description: The name of the carrier service that the price is related to. One carrier can have multiple prices if they have multiple services defined

service_id.description: The numeric ID of the carrier service for more reliable identification

price.description: The price for the requested shipment related to this carrier and service. The price is a float rounded to two decimal places, represented as a string

unit.description: The measurement unit by which the price was calculated

ParcelMachines.description: an array containing objects of the found parcel machines

items.description: A parcel machine object detailing information about the parcel machine, such as its name, location, references and info about its carrier

id.description: The numeric ID of this parcel machine

reference.description: The reference of this parcel machine (as referenced to by the carrier)

name.description: The name of this parcel machine

carrier_name.description: The name of the carrier of this parcel machine

carrier_id.description: The numeric ID of the carrier of this parcel machine

carrier_reg_no.description: The business registration number of the carrier of this parcel machine

address_row_1.description: The street address of this parcel machine

city.description: The name of the city of this parcel machine

postcode.description: The postcode of this parcel machine

country.description: The two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) of this parcel machine

object.description: an object containing shipment coordinates and co2e emissions

distances.description: an object containing shipment coordinates and distances

coordinates.description: an object containing collection and delivery coordinates

co2e_kg.description: Expected CO2e emissions for different freight types

Token.name: Authorization
Token.description: Enter your token in the format **Token <token>**
